We broke the contract in the Update Core by returning 'null' when description 
text is not defined. Update UI was not checking for null assuming it will get a 
String in all cases.

We will change the Javadoc and we fixed the UI. Until the next integration 
build, I suggest to add some text in the feature description element body. 
Apart from getting features to work, it is recommended to always provide a few 
sentences about the feature. In the current implementation, users must to click 
on 'More Info' to get ANY info. The intended behaviour was to get SOME info in 
the feature itself, and optionally read more by following the 'More Info' link.

What follows is my site.xml file. Looking at the Install/Update Help, I don't
see any opportunity to provide more descriptions than I already am. Can you
tell me exactly where I need to insert more description text to workaround
this problem?

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<site>
   <description>EditorList features</description>
   <feature url="features/editorlist_feature_1.0.4.jar">
      <category name="EditorList"/>
   </feature>
   <feature url="features/editorlist_feature_1.0.3.jar">
      <category name="EditorList"/>
   </feature>
   <feature url="features/editorlist_feature_1.0.2.jar">
      <category name="EditorList"/>
   </feature>
   <feature url="features/editorlist_feature_1.0.1.jar">
      <category name="EditorList"/>
   </feature>
   <feature url="features/editorlist_feature_1.0.0.jar">
      <category name="EditorList"/>
   </feature>

   <category-def name="EditorList" label="EditorList Plug-in for Eclipse">
      <description>The EditorList plug-in is an editor manager for Eclipse that presents editors in an convenient view.
      </description>
   </category-def>

</site>

The description is in the feature itself, not in site.xml. In feature.xml, you 
have element 'description' that can accept URL as an attribute (for 'More 
Info') and a short description as a body of the element:

<description url="moreInfo.html">
   A short description of the feature.
</description>

Ok. I had the description tag in my feature.xml, but for some reason I only
had the url definition with no text. I update the description in all of my
feature.xml files and my update site is working again. Thanks, Dejan. :)
